SENT.plain: Colorectal carcinoma is one of the most common cancers and one of the leading causes of cancer-related death in the United States
Pathologic examination of biopsy, polypectomy and resection specimens is crucial to appropriate patient managemnt, prognosis assessment and family counseling
Molecular testing plays an increasingly important role in the era of personalized medicine
This review article focuses on the histopathology and molecular pathology of colorectal carcinoma and its precursor lesions, with an emphasis on their clinical relevance
